name: Limited Edition FPC HIV/AIDS Bracelet
description: Frannie Peabody Center is Maineâ€™s oldest and largest HIV/AIDS service organization, providing medical case management, housing assistance, and emergency support for people in Maine living with HIV/AIDS. They also offer free, anonymous HIV testing at two locations in Southern Maine as well as education and outreach. Currently, the organization provides services to over 400 people living with HIV/AIDs. ------ The Ropes is humbled for the opportunity to partner with FPC and we're very excited to celebrate the hard work & resources they provide to folks in Maine! The Limited Edition FPC HIV/AIDS Bracelet is dedicated to all Mainers living with HIV/AIDS. Fifty percent of all sales will be donated to Frannie Peabody Center. This is a truly limited style with only 50 bracelets available. Get yours today! Constructed by hand using remnant marine rope and sterling silver hardware. Red rope with light gray specks wrapped in red. This stylish symbol of support comes in Small (6-6.5"), Medium (7-7.5"), and Large (8-8.5") sizes and is packaged in an authentic lobster bait bag. Each one is slightly different from the next. Made by hand in our Maine studio. ------ Sale Ends December 20th!
